lines.text: Just out for a breath of fresh air.

[while trying to hide Jimmy under a blanket]
Yes. The fresh air. It is fresh, isn't it?
Yes, it is.
There's nothing so fresh as fresh air because... t's so fresh.
...Yeah.
Did you kids have a good time at the beach today?
Oh, sure. I enjoy an occasional dip in the common pleasures of the proletariat.
If you knew what those words meant and could spell 'em, you'd be almost literate.
It's just that kids need a mother...
And they always will until someone makes a big improvement in incubators.
Give me five bourbons straight, will ya?
Five?
Yeah, for me and the four horsemen - Fire, Disease, Death, and Famine.
Heh, heh, that's a misquotation.
Yeah, yeah... just get the stuff.
It's a nice day.
You said that.
a great big sun, sky -
Yes, yes...
Well, I'm just trying to make conversation. I'm in there pitching!
High and outside.
